text: I'm Joe Keller Vice President of
Operations and Technology analytics at
Cox
Communications we have over 6 million
residential subscribers that we provide
Broadband services to that's internet
video and phone
services historically our industry has
relied upon our customers to serve as
our primary diagnostic contacting us
when they experience an
issue we were seeking some type of a
solution that would allow us to harness
the power of all the massive amounts of
data that we have from cable modems and
set tap boxes and put that to good use
enabling us to better detect and prevent
customer issues from happening and
that's where we started to work in
Amazon web services harnessing the power
of the Next Generation capabilities that
AWS has to offer Us in order to stand up
our novel framework called service
Health Service Health allows us to start
identifying patterns of imminent failure
proactively reaching out to our
customers in scenarios where they
experience
issues we decided to go with with Amazon
web services because of the
differentiating services ease of use and
the capabilities that the platform
offered us with traditional analytics
we're able to derive insights from
structured data with Amazon Bedrock
we're leveraging all the unstructured
data that's available to us this might
be anonymized customer transcripts
across chats and calls this might be the
journal entries that our technicians
make when they're trying to remediate
issues in our Network what we've been
able to do is provide forensic tools now
to our service Assurance teams our
network operations center as well as to
our technicians in the field to start
identifying optimizations across process
platforms and policies to help improve
upon their ability to resolve complex
and Elusive issues more
quickly this is an untapped Gold Mine of
data that prior to now we haven't been
able to tap
into
